page.title: 03WHALEY MOOR FARM.
page.content: Mr Brocksop began farming at Whaley Moor Farm in 1949, in partnership with his brother. He is a {tenant}of the Chatsworth Estate. After twelve years his bother took another farm and Mr Brocksop continued at Whaley Moor. The farm extends to{380 acres}and is used for both{stock}and arable farming. Crops grown include{wheat, {barley}and{potatoes.}The cattle are {British Friesians,}bought at three months old and fattened for beef. A number of changes have occurred since Mr Brocksop came to Whaley Moor. The farm has become highly mechanised and four men now do the work that once would have taken 15 to 18 men. Building changes include the demolition of 66% of the farm buildings to be replaced by an open span cattle yard and a new farmhouse.
